body_html:
Replacing for i in range(1, 100) by for i in range(2, 100) works fine.
I guess this is related to automatic broadcasting...

As far as building from source is concerned, I am on macOS 10.11.6 and Xcode 7.1.1 and I receive complaints about Xcode being too old. Not sure I want to update my OS just for this though :)
Is there a nightly build somewhere that I could install with conda?
body_text:
Replacing for i in range(1, 100) by for i in range(2, 100) works fine.
I guess this is related to automatic broadcasting...
As far as building from source is concerned, I am on macOS 10.11.6 and Xcode 7.1.1 and I receive complaints about Xcode being too old. Not sure I want to update my OS just for this though :)
Is there a nightly build somewhere that I could install with conda?
body:
Replacing `for i in range(1, 100)` by `for i in range(2, 100)` works fine.
I guess this is related to automatic broadcasting...

As far as building from source is concerned, I am on macOS 10.11.6 and Xcode 7.1.1 and I receive complaints about Xcode being too old. Not sure I want to update my OS just for this though :)
Is there a nightly build somewhere that I could install with conda?
